segments.text: How you doing?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Okay.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah. Wow.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We're all going to miss him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mmm hmm. I never knew it was going to be this hard, you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's weird 'cause it's like you expected it to happen and eventually-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: he had cancer, you know?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They thought he got--would get better and he did, and then it just- things turned bad.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turned around for the worst, you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I didn't know him, Tricia, but uh- I heard that he was a great man.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He was amazing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I loved that boy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We did everything together, you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's weird, I think. I feel so alone, you know? What am I going to do now? Now that he's gone.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He's so young. It seems so--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: so wrong in so many ways.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: His poor parents. You know, it's their only son.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: yeah.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Kind of a whole year. I mean, he suffered with this, this monster, this thing, this disease.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He was in chemo the whole time, right?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And he just got that baseball scholarship.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I know. He was, he had so much going for him.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So handsome, so young, so gifted.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So talented.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Such a sweet person, you know?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How's his parents doing?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not very good.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Can you imagine, though, you know, as a parent, just losing a kid? Twenty-two years old.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: It's weird, I kind of feel like part of me is gone now, you know?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Because this other half was just kind of like ripped away.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You guys were pretty close, weren't you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: He was like, he was like my brother, you know.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He was my brother.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Just seems so unfair, is the way it is.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know, he had that really pretty girlfriend for like about a year and-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What was her name?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Kelly. Kelly Uveny.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They talked about getting married and--
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Trying to have a baby.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah. But then when he got cancer and it got bad, you know, she just took off and-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: so I was there for him.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Some people.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah, but you were there all the hospital days. By his bed-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah. God, I loved that kid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: So nice, so positive.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: yeah.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We need more people like him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Joe, do you think he knew I loved him?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I never told him, I love you, but-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I loved him so much.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I don't know if Benny was smart like that- but-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm sure he loved you too. He just didn't know it.
segments.speaker: M
